TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed GeolocationAccuracy extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents levels of accuracy when determining location.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.Essentials.GeolocationAccuracy Best = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Represents the best accuracy, using the most power to obtain and typically within 10 meters.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.Essentials.GeolocationAccuracy High = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Represents high accuracy, typically within 10-100 meters.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.Essentials.GeolocationAccuracy Low = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Represents low accuracy, typically within 300-3000 meters.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.Essentials.GeolocationAccuracy Lowest = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Represents the lowest accuracy, using the least power to obtain and typically within 1000-5000 meters.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Xamarin.Essentials.GeolocationAccuracy Medium = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Represents medium accuracy, typically within 30-500 meters.
